#required for behaviour.xml
first=Natsuki
last=
label=Natsuki
gender=female
size=small
intelligence=average

#Number of phases to "finish" masturbating
timer=25

#Tags describe characters and allow dialogue directed to only characters with these tags, such as: confident, blonde, and british. All tags should be lower case. See tag_list.txt for a list of tags.
tag=natsuki
tag=ddlc
tag=visual_novel
tag=exotic_hair
tag=pink_hair
tag=medium_hair
tag=twintails
tag=violet_eyes
tag=fair-skinned
tag=small_breasts
tag=shaved
tag=short
tag=school_uniform
tag=bi-curious
tag=single
tag=student
tag=moe
tag=sarcastic
tag=tsundere
tag=boob_envy

#required for meta.xml
#select screen image
pic=0-calm
height=4'11"
from=Doki Doki Literature Club
writer=UnderscorM3, nmasp
artist=ManiacWithTheHex (Posing, model tweaks), Robotnik (Model)
description=One of the five members of the Literature club. Feisty for her small stature, Natsuki loves manga (which IS literature), and hates spiders.

#When selecting the characters to play the game, the first line will always play, then it randomly picks from any of the start lines after you commence the game but before you deal the first hand.
start=0-calm,W-wait a second, what's all this? Didn't I just walk into the Literature Club classroom?
start=0-woah,Oh, ~player~'s here? What's going on? This isn't the club room..?
start=0-woah,Nn-- poker? But... wait, this isn't our school, ~player~... Where are we?


#Items of clothing should be listed here in order of removal.
#The values are formal name, lower case name, how much they cover, what they cover
#Please do not put spaces around the commas.
#"Important" clothes cover genitals (lower) or chest/breasts (upper). For example: bras, panties, a skirt when going commando.
#"Major" clothes cover underwear. For example: skirts, pants, shirts, dresses.
#"Minor" clothes cover skin or are large pieces of clothing that do not cover skin. For example: jackets, socks, stockings, gloves.
#"Extra" clothes are small items that may or may not be clothing but do not cover anything interesting. For example: jewelry, shoes or boots with socks underneath, belts, hats. In the rest of the code, "extra" clothes are called "accessory".
#If for some reason you write another word for the type of clothes (e.g. "accessory"), other characters will not react at all when the clothing is removed.
#What they cover = upper (upper body), lower (lower body), other (neither).
#The game can support any number of entries, but typically we use 2-8, with at least one "important" layer for upper and lower (each).
clothes=Shoes and socks,shoes and socks,extra,other
clothes=Blazer,blazer,minor,upper
clothes=Cardigan,cardigan,minor,upper
clothes=Ribbon,ribbon,extra,other
clothes=Skirt,skirt,major,lower
clothes=Shirt,shirt,major,upper
clothes=Bra,bra,important,upper
clothes=Panties,panties,important,lower



#Notes on dialogue
#All lines that start with a # symbol are comments and will be ignored by the tool that converts this file into a xml file for the game.
#Where more than one line has an identical type, like "swap_cards" and "swap_cards", the game will randomly select one of these lines each time the character is in that situation.
#You should try to include multiple lines for most stages, especially the final (finished) stage, -1. 

#A character goes through multiple stages as they undress. The stage number starts at zero and indicates how many layers they have removed. Special stage numbers are used when they are nude (-3), masturbating (-2), and finished (-1).
#Line types that start with a number will only display during that stage. The will override any numberless stage-generic lines. For example, in stage 4 "4-swap_cards" will be used over "swap_cards" if it is not blank here. Giving a character unique dialogue for each stage is an effective way of showing their changing openness/shyness as the game progresses.
#You can combine the above points and make multiple lines for a particular situation in a particular stage, like "4-swap_cards" and "4-swap_cards".

#Some special words can be used that will be substituted by the game for context-appropriate ones: ~name~ is the name of the character they're speaking to, but this only works if someone else is in focus. ~clothing~ is the type of clothing that is being removed by another player. ~Clothing~ is almost the same, but it starts with a capital letter in case you want to start a sentence with it.
#~name~ can be used any time a line targets an opponent (game_over_defeat, _must_strip, _removing_, _removed, _must_masturbate, etc).
#~clothing~ can be used only when clothing is being removed (_removing and _removed, but NOT _must_strip).
#~player~ can be used at any time and refers to the human player.
#~cards~ can be used only in the swap_cards lines.
#All wildcards can be used once per line only! If you use ~name~ twice, the code will show up the second time.

#Lines can be written that are only spoken when specific other characters are present. For a detailed explanation, read this guide: https://www.reddit.com/r/spnati/comments/6nhaj0/the_easy_way_to_write_targeted_lines/
#Here is an example line (note that targeted lines must have a stage number):
#0-female_must_strip,target:hermioine=happy,Looks like your magic doesn't help with poker!




#EXCHANGING CARDS
#This is what a character says while they're exchanging cards.
#The game will automatically put a display a number between 0-5 where you write ~cards~.
#These lines display on the screen for only a brief time, so it is important to make them short enough to read at a glance.

#fully clothed
0-swap_cards=calm,~cards~. Hurry up.
0-swap_cards=calm,I'll take ~cards~.
0-swap_cards=calm,~cards~ bad ones...
0-swap_cards=donotwant,Why did-- ~cards~!
0-swap_cards=calm,3 is a lucky number at least...
0-swap_cards=calm,~cards~.
0-swap_cards=upset,4 is kinda an ugly number, right?
0-swap_cards=upset,Goodbye king, you won't be missed.
0-swap_cards=upset,1 is the loneliest number...
0-swap_cards=calm,~cards~ please.
0-swap_cards=calm,~cards~. ...Please.
0-swap_cards=calm,~cards~, I guess...
0-swap_cards=happy,A couplet, please!
0-swap_cards=upset,Wow. 5. Now.
0-swap_cards=calm,Um... ~cards~.
0-swap_cards=donotwant,Jeez! ~cards~!
0-swap_cards=happy,~cards~!
0-swap_cards=embarrassed,~cards~?
0-swap_cards=fear,Nnnnnn... ~cards~...
0-swap_cards=calm,~cards~...
0-swap_cards=tsun,But--! Ugh. ~cards~.
0-swap_cards=upset,N-nothing!
0-swap_cards=tsun,Should I...? No. ~cards~.
0-swap_cards=happy,...I'll do it! ~cards~.
0-swap_cards=fear,G-give me a second! Nn... ~cards~.
0-swap_cards=woah,~cards~!!
0-swap_cards=calm,~cards~, right?
0-swap_cards=calm,~cards~, obviously.
0-swap_cards=fear,S-skip me for now... Wait! Uh. ~cards~.
0-swap_cards=calm,Wait a sec. I'm mathing. Um. No... ~cards~?
0-swap_cards=mad,There are 56 cards, right? Or 52? ...54? Nnnnnnn... ~cards~.
0-swap_cards=calm,So the chance of getting that is like, 1 in 18, right? S-so ~cards~?
0-swap_cards=embarrassed,Cards, cards... ~cards~ more cards...
0-swap_cards=upset,~cards~... (<i>desu.</i>)
0-swap_cards=woah,Eeny, meeny, miny...
0-swap_cards=fear,Just a jack... New hand please.
0-swap_cards=donotwant,How about... ~cards~.
0-swap_cards=boobenvy,My best bet is to... ~cards~.
0-swap_cards=tsun,Blackjack is easier... ~cards~.
0-swap_cards=calm,In blackjack I could just say "hit"... ~cards~.
0-swap_cards=calm,Hit. ...Oh. Uh. ~cards~.
0-swap_cards=calm,Pass.
0-swap_cards=donotwant,Pass. No! ~cards~. (<i>It's</i> not <i>blackjack!</i>)
0-swap_cards=embarrassed,Why do the hands have to be so big... ~cards~.
0-swap_cards=fear,Go fish. ...Not that one! It was a joke! Just take the card I handed you!!
0-swap_cards=upset,Blackjack! ...Not that that matters. 4 please...
0-swap_cards=tsun,I'm more used to strip solitaire...
0-swap_cards,saidMarker:no_look_exhib2,notSaidMarker:no_look_exhib3=happy,Hmm? Oh yeah, my hand... ~cards~--!
0-swap_cards,alsoPlaying:aimee,alsoPlayingStage:1,alsoPlayingTimeInStage:0=,Um. ~cards~. Nnnnn...
0-swap_cards,alsoPlaying:alpha,saidMarker:alpha1,notSaidMarker:alpha2=happy,"Natsu Natsu Kii~!"
0-swap_cards,alsoPlaying:aimee,alsoPlayingStage:2,alsoPlayingTimeInStage:0=,Jeez, Aimee...
0-swap_cards,saidMarker:penis_perfect,notSaidMarker:pp2,priority:800=,(<i>Oh noooo...</i>)
0-swap_cards,alsoPlaying:florina,alsoPlayingStage:1,alsoPlayingSaidMarker:fled=fear,(<i>I say that but...</i>)
0-swap_cards,alsoPlaying:jura,alsoPlayingStage:3,alsoPlayingTimeInStage:0=,What I mean is...
0-swap_cards,alsoPlaying:human,alsoPlayingStage:1,alsoPlayingTimeInStage:0,saidMarker:player_f=,~player~-- Oh! ~cards~ please. Thanks. ~player~!
0-swap_cards,alsoPlaying:monika,alsoPlayingStage:5,alsoPlayingTimeInStage:0=upset,... ~cards~...
0-swap_cards,alsoPlaying:monika,alsoPlayingStage:1,alsoPlayingTimeInStage:0=calm,That's Monika for you. ~cards~.
0-swap_cards,alsoPlaying:monika,alsoPlayingStage:2,alsoPlayingTimeInStage:0=upset,I-I'm sorry Monika, I...
0-swap_cards,alsoPlaying:monika,alsoPlayingStage:5,alsoPlayingTimeInStage:0=calm,(<i>Calm down, idiot...</i>) ~cards~.
0-swap_cards,totalRounds:0=woah,Oh, poker... poker... ~cards~ cards.
0-swap_cards,totalRounds:0=woah,Wait! I'm a bit... uh... ~cards~.
0-swap_cards,totalRounds:0=woah,So it's poker, right? That means... ~cards~.

#lost ribbon
4-swap_cards=donotwant,...This card is wet ...Ewwww!! Take it! Take it!!
4-swap_cards=mad,I'm mad at you, ~player~. ~cards~ cards, please.
4-swap_cards=tsun,(<i>Damn it, ~player~...</i>) ~cards~.
4-swap_cards=mad,Don't just-- ~cards~, okay?
4-swap_cards=tsun,~player~, what do you think...? No, I <i>won't</i> tell you what my hand is!

4-swap_cards=mad,...Stupid lousy no good ~cards~ cards...

#These lines appear each round when a character is commenting on how good or bad their hand is.
#The lines written here are examples only and should be replaced.

#stage-specific lines that override the stage-generic ones
good_hand=happy,I've got a good hand! But I really have some great poker tips!

0-good_hand,saidMarker:tips,priority:0=happy,This is a useful mnemonic, ~player~: pears taste sweet! So go for pairs!
0-good_hand,saidMarker:tips,priority:0=embarrassed,Don't worry about poker faces, ~player~. Just do your hand. Uh. I mean *our* faces. Not face cards.
0-good_hand,saidMarker:tips,priority:0=tsun,I think the loser usually isn't even going to have a pair. So don't be that person, ~player~!
0-good_hand,saidMarker:tips,priority:0=happy,Here's something to remember: If it's lower than a jack, it's not <i>worth</i> jack! ...unless it's a pair.

#The "human" versions of the lines will only be spoken if the human player is stripping.

#OPPONENT REMOVING ACCESSORY
#These lines are spoken when an opponent removes a small item that does not cover any skin.
#Typically, characters are fine with this when they are fully dressed but less satisfied as they become more naked.
#Note that all "removing" lines are NOT spoken to human players. Characters will skip straight from "6-male_human_must_strip" to "6-male_removed_accessory", for example.

#stage-specific lines that override the stage-generic ones
male_removing_accessory=calm,I'm not sure what <i>I'd</i> choose for you...
male_removing_accessory=happy,So. What will it be?
male_removing_accessory=embarrassed,Aww. It doesn't look like we're going to see anything big come off this round.
male_removing_accessory=mad,Yeah, it makes sense he'd pick something small and uninteresting.
male_removed_accessory=donotwant,That sure was a long wait for just your ~clothing~.
male_removed_accessory=tsun,Your ~clothing~? Jeez. Someone's trying to drag this out.
male_removed_accessory=tsun,Your ~clothing~ was so tiny. Why are guys wearing stuff like that anyway?
male_removed_accessory=smug,Keep picking lame stuff like your ~clothing~, ~name~. It's not like I'd stick around for bigger stuff.
male_removed_accessory=upset,You know, ~name~, for a man you're trying awfully hard to accessorize.
male_removed_accessory=mad,You're so indecisive! Only picking something like your ~clothing~!
female_removing_accessory=upset,I'm not sure what <i>I'd</i> choose for you...
female_removing_accessory=smug,So. What will it be?
female_removing_accessory=tsun,Aww. It doesn't look like we're going to see anything big come off this round.
female_removing_accessory=calm,Yeah, it makes sense she'd pick something small. I don't blame her.
female_removed_accessory=donotwant,That sure was a long wait for just your ~clothing~.
female_removed_accessory=tsun,Your ~clothing~? Jeez. Someone's trying to drag this out.
female_removed_accessory=embarrassed,Ugh. I want to chat about accessories and fashion and stuff, but this isn't really the mood for that, right?
female_removed_accessory=tsun,Nn-- okay <i>maybe</i> I'd want to compare accessories, just not at a stupid game like this...

#OPPONENT REMOVING MINOR CLOTHING
#Minor pieces of clothing don't reveal much when removed, but probably indicate more progress than accessory removal.

#stage-specific lines that override the stage-generic ones
male_removing_minor=calm,You're taking off your ~clothing~? That's no big deal, right ~name~?
male_removing_minor=happy,So, what are your options...?
male_removing_minor=smug,I wonder if you could <i>half</i>-remove something big. Or would that be cheating?
male_removed_minor=smug,I guess that works.
male_removed_minor=woah,See, it looks better on the floor. All... stripped... and stuff.
male_removed_minor=fear,Heh... I 'd hate to have to...
male_removed_minor=happy,I'm glad it wasn't me!

#OPPONENT MASTURBATING
#When an opponent is naked and loses a hand, they have lost the game and must pay the penalty by masturbating in front of everyone.
#The "must_masturbate" line is for just before it happens, and the "start_masturbating" line immediately follows.
#The "masturbating" line will be spoken a little after the opponent has started but before they climax.
#When the opponent climaxes, your character will say the "finished_masturbating" line.

#stage-specific lines that override the stage-generic ones

#GAME OVER VICTORY

#stage-generic line that will be used for every individual stage that doesn't have a line written

#stage-specific lines that override the stage-generic ones
game_over_victory=happy,Ehehe. See, just like I tell people in the Literature Club: sometimes the most powerful plays you can make are the small ones.
game_over_victory=happy,O-of course I won. I'm a pro!
game_over_victory=happy,I guess you underestimated me, huh?
